snippet: For many Syrian families in Jordan’s refugee camps, marrying girls off at younger ages is seen as necessary, but women’s advocates say that they are trading immediate dangers for longer-term ones.
abstract: Many Syrian families in Jordan's refugee camps marry off young girls to ease financial burden and allay fears of rape and sexual harassment in makeshift living spaces; Unicef reports number of marriages involving girls younger than 18 has ballooned since start of the Syrian war; international aid groups warn women who marry young often become victims of domestic violence and have troubled pregnancies.
lead_paragraph: For many Syrian families in Jordan’s refugee camps, marrying girls off at younger ages is seen as necessary, but women’s advocates say that they are trading immediate dangers for longer-term ones.

headline.main: In Jordan, Ever Younger Syrian Brides
headline.print_headline: In Jordan, Ever Younger Syrian Brides
